'''8 April 2011''': The '''"Friday of Cleansing"'''; Hundreds of thousands of demonstrators filled Tahrir Square for the largest protests in weeks, criticizing the ruling Supreme Council of the Armed Forces for not following through on revolution demands. They demanded the resignation of remaining regime figures, and the removal of Egyptâs public prosecutor due to the slow pace of investigations of corrupt former officials.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/391552 |title=Tens of thousands in Tahrir as some threaten to extend protests | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=2011-04-09}}</ref>

'''13 April 2011''': Egyptâs Prosecutor General has ordered the detention 15 days of the Egyptian former president and his two children , Alaa and Gamal, has officially informed. A statement from the Attorney General Egyptian published on its website on Facebook, the arrest warrant was issued after the prosecution presented the charges against them and in accordance with the development of the criminal investigations around the rioting that led to the fall of the regime .

'''13 April 2011''': Egyptâs Prosecutor General has ordered the detention 15 days of the Egyptian former president and his two children , [[Alaa Mubarak]] and [[Gamal Mubarak]], has officially informed. A statement from the Attorney General Egyptian published on its website on Facebook, the arrest warrant was issued after the prosecution presented the charges against them and in accordance with the development of the criminal investigations around the rioting that led to the fall of the regime<ref>{{cite web|author=Mark Gregory |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-13058855 |title=BBC News â Egypt: Mubarak and sons detained amid corruption probe |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-04-14}}</ref>.

'''16 April 2011''': The Egyptian supreme administrative court ordered to dissolve the former ruling National Democratic Party (NDP) and hand its assets to the government<ref>{{cite news |title=Egypt dissolves former ruling party |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/2011416125051889315.html |newspaper= |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=16 April 2011}}</ref>.
